text: so Iike this is the super short version
of two ways to make a Thai omelette for

below let's get started
two eggs and a teaspoon of fish sauce or
soy sauce that's it
beat it up real good and now there are
two different ways to cook this up the
first way you'll need about a half an
inch of oil and get it really really hot
in goes the eggs and just wait until
it's nice and brown and crispy around
the edges then flip it over for just a
few seconds and it's done
the second way uses less oil but it
won't have the crispy edges that the
first one does so a little oil in a
non-stick pan at the eggs and keep
making room for the runny egg to come
into contact with the pan and when it's
set enough to flip just go for it and
that's it super easy so Thai omelette is
always served with some jasmine rice and
the original Sierra cha hot sauce and
there you go that was probably the
easiest meal ever for the full version
